summary: Completed comprehensive testing of RheumaCare E-Prescription Portal - Edit Prescription feature and all related functionality working correctly. All 19 backend API tests passed. Frontend Edit flow, new fields (Vitals, Advice, Lab Tests), and PDF generation verified.
passed_tests: Edit button visible on PrescriptionHistory page (table row actions)
Edit button visible on PrescriptionView page (header)
Edit form loads with 'Edit Prescription' title
Edit form populates all fields correctly from existing prescription
Edit form populates new fields: Vitals, Advice, Lab Tests
Edit form populates all 12 drugs for multi-page prescription
Update prescription saves changes and redirects to view page
Changes persist after update (verified with GET)
PDF generation returns valid PDF for multi-page prescription
PDF has header on all pages (verified via API)
New fields (Vitals, Advice, Lab Tests) visible in form and view
Wider Frequency column displays custom frequencies correctly (Once weekly, 0-0-1 SOS)
All CRUD operations working (Create, Read, Update, Delete)

success_rate.frontend: 100% (all Edit functionality and new features working)

seed_data_creation: Test prescription with 12 drugs exists with ID: e84243a9-fb4b-4176-bc50-faf9bead4587 for multi-page PDF testing
context_for_next_testing_agent: Edit Prescription feature fully implemented and tested. PUT /api/prescriptions/{id} endpoint working. Frontend detects edit mode via URL parameter (:id in /prescription/:id/edit route). New fields (Vitals, Advice, Lab Tests) are functional. Multi-page PDF generation working with header on all pages and footer only on last page.
